title: Good place
pros: Good work life balance and benefits

title: great job
pros: great job, never head a problem
cons: very fast paste, hard to take a break

title: Very Black and White Company - No Grey allowed!!
pros: Great company. 40 hour work weeks. Great for a 9-5er. Long stable company.
cons: Beware of backstabbers! Co-workers smile in your face, and talk about you behind your back. On the outside, the company is awesome. In reality, there's no room for growth, and depending on your department, you may be doing mundane assignments everyday. If you're looking to be creative, and grow in commercial real estate, find somewhere else to work.

title: Intern
pros: Good internal office network, strong ability to succeed in the industry. The day-to-day level of work was manageable and there wasn't a lot of competitive pressure not frustrating blocks to communication. Everyone is friendly.
cons: top management is a bit disengaged and the project themselves could be a bit more planned out. I felt pretty underused and there could be a lot more coming from this company.

title: A good stable company with room for improvement
pros: Convenient location in downtown Orlando, accessible by SunRail, with good benefits, and a positive group of people to work with.
cons: The company runs lean so there are limited career growth opportunities available.

title: Good People to Work With
pros: Good people to work with Good company benefits
cons: Training is very little if any Department heads do not have their workers' back

title: positive environment, but old school
cons: Could stand to be more progressive

title: Analyst Position
pros: Big Company with a lot of assets. Neat office building.
cons: Lack of communication. Hierarchy of all white people with little diversity except in Human Resources just to keep up their appearances. Extremely slow decision making. Little respect for others, everybody is paranoid over their job security constantly.

title: Different place to work when new management took over
pros: Very competent people that are willing to share ideas. Reasonable work life balance. Most accounting jobs are like working deep underground.
cons: Company structure designed for four people to set all durection and make all desisions amd for five people to get 50% of the compensation.
